primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters the human condition in Christ to expose the hideousness of sin and achieve a victory of love/forgiveness that delivers humanity from captivity.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has not only become man in order to get with us but also has entered the deepest and most convulsive experiences
Jesus at Calvary made sin, human evil, overstretch, expose itself
He saved others because he would not save himself

object.identificatie: Deliverance/Salvation of humanity and the exposure of sin's true nature.
tekstueel_bewijs: something has been done for us that nobody but Jesus could do
the prisoner's cell door swings wide
the supreme act of God's love
the final thrust of God's mercy
gives us a bright and blessed hope
something has been done for us
strong enough, brave enough, who cared enough to become a man
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject acting through the Helper (Christ's humanity).

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin (as a cosmic/internal power) and the 'Mad men' (human actors).
tekstueel_bewijs: the ugly, stubborn mystery of sin
death-dealing envy and prejudice which reside in all of us
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a 'mystery' and a 'captivity' that 'spoils all of life,' requiring a divine intervention rather than just moral effort.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response: looking at the cross, recognizing sin, and living a life of self-sacrifice for others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Christian
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Recognition of sin and service to neighbor.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/response) is presented as a result of 'taking another look' at what God has already done.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has entered the deepest and most convulsive experiences
Jesus at Calvary made sin... expose itself
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We tend to see this rebellion
We reach for figures and metaphors

voorbeelden: God who loved enough, was strong enough, brave enough
Calvary exposes the hideous quality of human sin
we know something has been done for us
strong enough to become a man

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' (Power) to save where man is 'defenseless' and 'captive.' It is a theology of Divine Competence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'winking at wrong' (~S1) to the 'exposure' of sin at the cross (~S2), leading to the 'deliverance' (S1) that overcomes the 'captivity' (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ taking the 'fatal plunge' into S2 to open S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Sin is described as 'hideous' and 'repulsive,' not just a mistake.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. God is the primary actor (Subject) of the salvation event. Human action is framed as a response to a finished divine work.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The father of modest means seeking to save his child... The Christian seeking to win others...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has not only become man... but also has entered the deepest and most convulsive experiences
the ugly, stubborn mystery of sin... captivity of our own fleshly desires

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human examples (sister, father) are used to illustrate the principle of 'saving others by not saving oneself,' but they are subordinate to Christ's unique work.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: None (Jesus is the Savior, not just a model)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: N/A - The sermon already prioritizes the theocentric reading.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is 'done for us' by 'nobody but Jesus'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'exposure of sin' to the 'victory of love' is logically and narratively seamless.
spanning_punten: The shift from sin as a cosmic mystery to sin as 'social section/race' creates a slight tension between ontological and sociological hamartology.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The supreme moment of victory... the prisoner's cell door swings wide.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on Christ's work rather than the Spirit's application.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'death-dealing' force that requires an 'emancipation'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative. The 'engine' of the sermon is the Power (Pouvoir) of God's love.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on Devoir (obligation), which is appropriate for a grace-centered sermon.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) is clearly linked as a 'Vouloir' (desire) born from the 'Savoir' (knowing) of the Cross.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already avoids 'cheap grace' by intensifying the ugliness of sin.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses the actantial role of God to drive the narrative of grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'tremble' imagery, Greimas reveals that the 'tremble' is a reaction to a Subject-switch (from Man's effort to God's plunge).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the 'place called Calvary'; Greimas focuses on the 'functional role' of Calvary as the site of the Subject's performance.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'jeerers' at the cross function as an 'Opponent' who accidentally defines the 'Object' (He saved others).

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (made sin expose itself, saved others, prays)
Sin (put Jesus on the cross, destroys land)
We (tend to see, wink at wrong, need grace)
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'If-Then' conditional trap, maintaining a 'Because-Therefore' structure.
